page.title: 07General Features
page.content: Our block is generally{forestry}and {farmland.}There are also three housing estates on the western side of Guisborough.They are{Galley Hill,Pine {Hills}and{Hutton Meadows}estates. The two{A roads}which pass through our block are the{A171}and the{A173. There is an{old disused railway line from{Middlesbrough}which carried {passengers,goods,minerals and coal.}It {closed}about{1964. Also in the area is the sight of an {old lepers hospital}just on the edge of the moors. There is one large stream that flows west to east through our block called {Hutton beck. {The Kings Head,The Voyager}and{The {Cross Keys}are the{three pubs}in the area. The area has two{large houses}called {Hutton Hall}and{Pinchinthorpe Hall.
